V. CONSULTATION

• The facility did not request or require consultation.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency had one investigation involving staff not changing a youth’s briefs before
sending him to school and there was a violation for Rule 400. 4148 Personal
Hygiene. The staff involved was reeducated and the residentional supervisor has
been running daily reports to ensure compliance.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the agency's
budget and financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was done on time and was comprehensive and
reviewed the areas of noncompliance from the previous licensing review. There
are no citations from the 2023 interim inspection and no citations were found in
this renewal inspection.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two direct care staff and one supervisor were interviewed. Staff reported feeling
supported by their supervisor and upper management. Staff reported having
sufficient training and tools to do their jobs. They said the facility’s main goal is
ensuring the safety and well-being of the youths, and all the staff strive at ensuring
all the youths needs are being met.
Three youths were interviewed. They reported all their needs are being met and
expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.

Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the agency occurred on 11/08/2023. the
agency was found to be clean, neat, and appropriate. Kitchen observed to have
menu posted, plenty of food, and very clean. No concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
